kpi_info.title: period_duration (period_duration)
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: MAX_AVAIL_R99_CE (M5006C0)
kpi_info.use: The maximum number of available R99 CEs. In Flexi Rel. 2 HW and Flexi Rel. 3 HW WCDMA BTS, when baseband pooling is not used, the counter is the sum of: - maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity and - R99 CE capacity of hybrid HSUPA resource steps. In Flexi Rel. 2 HW and Flexi Rel. 3 HW WCDMA BTS, when baseband pooling is in use, the counter is the sum of: - maximum amount of Local Cell Group dedicated baseband pool of R99 CE licensed capacity, - R99 CE capacity of hybrid HSUPA resource steps, and - total amount of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool decreased by licensed R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment. Note: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then HW capacity is indicated in the counter. UPDATED: The counter is updated when the HW or the licensed capacity changes in the BTS.

kpi_info.title: AVG_AVAIL_R99_CE (M5006C1)
kpi_info.use: The average number of available R99 Channel Elements. In Ultrasite EUBB WCDMA BTS, the counter is the average amount of working baseband resources (HW capacity). In Flexi Rel2 & Flexi Rel3 WCDMA BTS when baseband pooling is not used, the counter is the average amount of R99 CE licensed capacity + R99 CE capacity of hybrid CFs. In Flexi Rel2 & Flexi Rel3 WCDMA BTS when baseband pooling is in use, the counter is the average amount of Local Cell Group dedicated baseband pool R99 CE licensed capacity + R99 CE capacity of hybrid CFs + total amount of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool - licensed R99 CEs used by other Local Cell groups from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment. Note: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity then HW capacity is indicated in the counter. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value from all the samples during the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: MIN_AVAIL_R99_CE (M5006C2)
kpi_info.use: The minimum number of available R99 Channel Elements. In Ultrasite EUBB WCDMA BTS, the counter is the minimum amount of working baseband resources (HW capacity). In Flexi Rel2 & Flexi Rel3 WCDMA BTS when baseband pooling is not used, the counter is the minimum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity + R99 CE capacity of hybrid CFs. In Flexi Rel2 & Flexi Rel3 WCDMA BTS when baseband pooling is in use, the counter is the minimum amount of Local Cell Group dedicated baseband pool R99 CE licensed capacity + R99 CE capacity of hybrid CFs + total amount of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool - licensed R99CEs used by other Local Cell groups from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment. Note: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity then HW capacity is indicated in the counter. UPDATED: The counter is updated when the HW or the licensed capacity changes in the BTS.

kpi_info.title: MAX_USED_R99_CE_DL (M5006C3)
kpi_info.use: The maximum number of used R99 CEs in the DL direction. The counter includes: - R99 CEs - hybrid HSUPA resource steps used by R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in counters. Note2: The number of used R99 CEs can temporarily exceed the licensed capacity when the PS radio bearer bit rate is upgraded. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is calculated every 5 seconds. Samples are based on the maximum used R99 channel elements in the DL direction.

kpi_info.title: AVG_USED_R99_CE_DL (M5006C4)
kpi_info.use: The average number of used R99 CEs in DL direction. The counter includes: - R99 CEs - hybrid HSUPA resource steps used by R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in counters. Note2: The number of used R99 CEs can temporarily exceed the licensed capacity when the PS radio bearer bit rate is upgraded. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value from of all the samples during the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: MIN_USED_R99_CE_DL (M5006C5)
kpi_info.use: The minimum number of used R99 CEs in DL direction. The counter includes: - R99 CEs - hybrid HSUPA resource steps used by R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in counters. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is calculated every 5 seconds. Samples are based on the minimum used channel elements in the DL direction.

kpi_info.title: MAX_USED_R99_CE_UL (M5006C6)
kpi_info.use: The maximum number of used R99 CEs in UL direction. The counter includes: - R99 CEs - hybrid HSUPA resource steps used by R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in counters. Note2: The number of used R99 CEs can temporarily exceed the licensed capacity when the PS radio bearer bit rate is upgraded. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is calculated every 5 seconds. Samples are based on the maximum used R99 channel elements in the UL direction.

kpi_info.title: AVG_USED_R99_CE_UL (M5006C7)
kpi_info.use: The average number of used R99 CEs in UL direction. The counter includes: - R99 CEs - hybrid HSUPA resource steps used by R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in counters. Note2: The number of used R99 CEs can temporarily exceed the licensed capacity when the PS radio bearer bit rate is upgraded. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value from of all the samples during the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: MIN_USED_R99_CE_UL (M5006C8)
kpi_info.use: The minimum number of used R99 CEs in UL direction. The counter includes: - R99 CEs - hybrid HSUPA resource steps used by R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in counters. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is calculated every 5 seconds. Samples are based on the minimum used channel elements in the UL direction.

kpi_info.title: BTS_R99_CE_UTIL_UL_CLASS_1 (M5006C9)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (0 - <50)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) R99 CEs. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (0 - 50)% class.

kpi_info.title: BTS_R99_CE_UTIL_UL_CLASS_2 (M5006C10)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (50 - <70)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) R99 CEs. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (50 - <70)% class.

kpi_info.title: BTS_R99_CE_UTIL_UL_CLASS_3 (M5006C11)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (70 - <80)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) R99 CEs. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (70 - <80)% class.

kpi_info.title: BTS_R99_CE_UTIL_UL_CLASS_4 (M5006C12)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (80 - <90)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) R99 CEs. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (80 - <90)% class.

kpi_info.title: BTS_R99_CE_UTIL_UL_CLASS_5 (M5006C13)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (90 - <100)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) R99 CEs. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (90 - <100)% class.

kpi_info.title: BTS_R99_CE_UTIL_UL_CLASS_6 (M5006C14)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the 100% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements (CE) in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) CEs. Note: Counter consider usage of 100% or more, since BTS allows temporarily exceeding the licensed capacity. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is (100 or more)%

kpi_info.title: BTS_R99_CE_UTIL_DL_CLASS_1 (M5006C15)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (0 - <50)% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) R99 CEs. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (0 - 50)% class.

kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (50 - <70)% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) R99 CEs. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the 100% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the total number of R99 Channel Elements (CE) in use divided by the number of all available (licensed) CEs. Note: Counter consider usage of 100% or more, since BTS allows temporarily exceeding the licensed capacity. The number of R99 Channel Elements in use is the sum of: - R99 CE consumed by the R99 users - R99 CEs used for CCCHs. CCCHs don't use R99 CEs if the BTS includes Flexi Rel3 HW. Note1: Only additional CCCHs are calculated; that is, the CCCH capacity included in the HW price is not visible in the counter. Available R99 Channel Elements includes: - the maximum amount of R99 CE licensed capacity dedicated for the LCG, - R99 CE capacity of the hybrid HSUPA Processing Set license in the LCG, - if baseband pooling is used: total number of licensed R99 CEs in the common baseband pool minus R99 CEs used by other LCGs from the common baseband pool at the counter sampling moment Note2: If HW capacity available for LCG is less than licensed capacity, then available R99 Channel Elements is equal to HW capacity. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is (100 or more)%

kpi_info.title: MAX_AVAIL_CSOHSPA_CE (M5006C21)
kpi_info.use: The maximum number of available CSoHSPA Channel Elements. In Flexi rel2 WCDMA BTS when baseband pooling is in use, the counter indicates maximum number of CSoHSPA Channel Elements available for the LCG at the counter sampling moment. UPDATED: When the HW capacity changes in the BTS.

kpi_info.title: AVG_AVAIL_CSOHSPA_CE (M5006C22)
kpi_info.use: The average number of available CSoHSPA Channel Elements. In Flexi rel2 WCDMA BTS when baseband pooling is in use, the counter indicates average number of CSoHSPA Channel Elements available for the LCG at the counter sampling moment. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value from all the samples during the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: MIN_AVAIL_CSOHSPA_CE (M5006C23)
kpi_info.use: The minimum number of available CSoHSPA Channel Elements. In Flexi rel2 WCDMA BTS when baseband pooling is in use, the counter indicates minimum number of CSoHSPA Channel Elements available for the LCG at the counter sampling moment. UPDATED: When the HW or the licensed capacity changes in the BTS.

kpi_info.title: MAX_USED_CSOHSPA_CE (M5006C24)
kpi_info.use: Maximum number of used CSoHSPA Channel Elements. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The counter value is calculated on the cycle of 5 seconds samples based on the maximum used CSoHSPA channel elements.

kpi_info.title: AVG_USED_CSOHSPA_CE (M5006C25)
kpi_info.use: Average number of used CSoHSPA Channel Elements. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value from all the samples during the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: MIN_USED_CSOHSPA_CE (M5006C26)
kpi_info.use: Minimum number of used CSoHSPA Channel Elements. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The counter value is calculated on the cycle of 5 seconds samples based on the minimum used channel elements.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_UL_CLASS_1 (M5006C27)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (0 - <50)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSUPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSUPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (0 - 50)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_UL_CLASS_2 (M5006C28)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (50 - <70)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSUPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSUPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (50 - <70)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_UL_CLASS_3 (M5006C29)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (70 - <80)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSUPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSUPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (70 - <80)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_UL_CLASS_4 (M5006C30)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (80 - <90)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSUPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSUPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (80 - <90)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_UL_CLASS_5 (M5006C31)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (90 - <100)% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSUPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSUPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (90 - <100)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_UL_CLASS_6 (M5006C32)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the 100% class per uplink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSUPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSUPA users. Note: The counter considers usage of 100% or more, since BTS allows to exceed the licensed capacity temporarily. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is 100% or more

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_DL_CLASS_1 (M5006C33)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (0 - <50)% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSDPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSDPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (0 - 50)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_DL_CLASS_2 (M5006C34)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (50 - <70)% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSDPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSDPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (50 - <70)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_DL_CLASS_3 (M5006C35)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (70 - <80)% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSDPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSDPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (70 - <80)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_DL_CLASS_4 (M5006C36)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (80 - <90)% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSDPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSDPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (80 - <90)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_DL_CLASS_5 (M5006C37)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (90 - <100)% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSDPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSDPA users. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (90 - <100)% class.

kpi_info.title: HSPA_USER_UTIL_DL_CLASS_6 (M5006C38)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the 100% class per downlink direction. Each utilization rate sample calculates the number of HSDPA users in use divided by the licensed number of HSDPA users. Note: The counter considers usage of 100% or more, since BTS allows to exceed the licensed capacity temporarily. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is 100% or more

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_USED_SU (M5006C39)
kpi_info.use: The average number of used LCG baseband subunits over the whole measurement period duration, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period, summing all the samples and dividing by the number of samples for the measurement period duration. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. The counter does not contain free CCCH resources included in HW price. UPDATED:The counter is updated at the start of each predefined sampling period. The counter values are calculated on the cycle of five-second samples. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_USED_SU (M5006C40)
kpi_info.use: The sample with the maximum number of used LCG baseband subunits, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period for the measurement period duration. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. The counter does not contain HSDPA resources and free CCCH resources included in HW price. UPDATED: The counter is updated at the start of each predefined sampling period. The counter values are calculated on the cycle of five-second samples. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVAIL_SU (M5006C41)
kpi_info.use: The number of available subunits in LCG. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. The counter does not contain free CCCH resources included in HW price. UPDATED:The counter is updated when BTS HW capacity or LCG configuration is changed.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_HSUPA_USED_SU (M5006C42)
kpi_info.use: The average number of LCG subunits used by HSUPA over the whole measurement period duration, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period, summing all the samples and dividing by the number of samples for the measurement period duration. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. The counter does not contain PIC pool resources. UPDATED:The counter is updated at the start of each predefined sampling period. The counter values are calculated on the cycle of five-second samples. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_HSUPA_USED_SU (M5006C43)
kpi_info.use: The sample with the maximum amount of LCG subunits actively used by HSUPA, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period for the measurement period duration. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. The counter does not contain PIC pool resources. UPDATED:The counter is updated at the start of each predefined sampling period. The counter values are calculated on the cycle of 5 seconds samples. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVAIL_HSUPA_SU (M5006C44)
kpi_info.use: The number of available subunits for HSUPA traffic in LCG. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. UPDATED:The counter is updated when BTS HW capacity, LCG configuration, HS-FACH allocation or PIC allocation is changed.

kpi_info.title: LCG_ALLOC_HSDPA_SU (M5006C45)
kpi_info.use: The number of subunits allocated for HSDPA processing in LCG. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. UPDATED: The counter is updated, when HSDPA is allocated in BTS (system module start-up), BTS HW capacity, LCG configuration has changed or HSDPA cell is allocated/deleted (PSCR).

kpi_info.title: LCG_NUM_R99_HSUPA_OVERL_SU (M5006C46)
kpi_info.use: The number of LCG available subunits for R99 and HSUPA licenses overlapping resources. Notes: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. UPDATED: The counter is updated when BTS HW capacity, commissioning or R99 CE / HSUPA PS licenses amount is changed.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_USED_R99_OVERL_SU (M5006C47)
kpi_info.use: The average number of LCG subunits used by R99 from the R99 and HSUPA licenses overlapping resources, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period for the measurement period duration. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. UPDATED: The counter is updated at the start of each predefined sampling period. The counter values are calculated on the cycle of 5.12 second samples. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_USED_HSUPA_OVERL_SU (M5006C48)
kpi_info.use: The average number of LCG subunits used by HSUPA from the R99 and HSUPA licenses overlapping resources, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period for the measurement period duration. Note: Counter unit is the smallest subunit in the BTS. UPDATED: The counter is updated at the start of each predefined sampling period. The counter values are calculated on the cycle of 5.12 second samples. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_HW_RES_UTIL_CLASS_1 (M5006C49)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (0 - <50) % class. Each utilization rate sample calculates the used HW resources divided by the available HW resources inside the LCG. The used HW resources includes additional CCCH resources, DCH, HSUPA, PIC and HS-FACH. Note: CCCH capacity included in HW price and HSDPA allocation are not included in the calculation. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (0 - 50)% class.

kpi_info.title: LCG_HW_RES_UTIL_CLASS_2 (M5006C50)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (50 - <70) % class. Each utilization rate sample calculates the used HW resources divided by the available HW resources inside the LCG. The used HW resources includes additional CCCH resources, DCH, HSUPA, PIC and HS-FACH. Note: CCCH capacity included in HW price and HSDPA allocation are not included in the calculation. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (50 - <70)% class.

kpi_info.title: LCG_HW_RES_UTIL_CLASS_3 (M5006C51)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (70 - <80) % class. Each utilization rate sample calculates the used HW resources divided by the available HW resources inside the LCG. The used HW resources includes additional CCCH resources, DCH, HSUPA, PIC and HS-FACH. Note: CCCH capacity included in HW price and HSDPA allocation are not included in the calculation. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (70 - <80)% class.

kpi_info.title: LCG_HW_RES_UTIL_CLASS_4 (M5006C52)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (80 - <90) % class. Each utilization rate sample calculates the used HW resources divided by the available HW resources inside the LCG. The used HW resources includes additional CCCH resources, DCH, HSUPA, PIC and HS-FACH. Note: CCCH capacity included in HW price and HSDPA allocation are not included in the calculation. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (80 - <90)% class.

kpi_info.title: LCG_HW_RES_UTIL_CLASS_5 (M5006C53)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the (90 - <100) % class. Each utilization rate sample calculates the HW resources utilization inside the LCG. The used HW resources includes additional CCCH resources, DCH, HSUPA, PIC and HS-FACH. Note: CCCH capacity included in HW price and HSDPA allocation are not included in the calculation. UPDATED: The counter is incremented when the sample of the utilization rate is within (90 - <100)% class.

kpi_info.title: LCG_HW_RES_UTIL_CLASS_6 (M5006C54)
kpi_info.use: The counter shows how many utilization rate samples have been detected within the 100 % class. Each utilization rate sample calculates the used HW resources divided by the available HW resources inside the LCG. The used HW resources includes additional CCCH resources, DCH, HSUPA, PIC and HS-FACH. Note: Class 6 considers utilization of 100% or more.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_HSDPA_USERS (M5006C55)
kpi_info.use: The maximum number of HSDPA users in LCG, obtained by sampling with a predefined sampling period during the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_HSDPA_USERS (M5006C56)
kpi_info.use: The average number of HSDPA users in LCG, obtained by sampling with a predefined sampling period during the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVAIL_HSDPA_USERS (M5006C57)
kpi_info.use: The number of available HSDPA users in LCG. UPDATED: The counter is updated when LCG HW capacity, LCG configuration or HSDPA PS licenses amount is changed.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_HSUPA_USERS (M5006C58)
kpi_info.use: The maximum number of HSUPA users in LCG, obtained by sampling with a predefined sampling period during the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_HSUPA_USERS (M5006C59)
kpi_info.use: The average number of HSUPA users in LCG, obtained by sampling with a predefined sampling period during the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples in the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVAIL_HSUPA_USERS (M5006C60)
kpi_info.use: The number of available HSUPA users in LCG. UPDATED: The counter is updated when LCG HW capacity, LCG configuration or HSUPA PS licenses amount is changed.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_HSDPA_THR (M5006C61)
kpi_info.use: Maximum HSDPA MAC-hs/ehs throughput (including retransmissions) in LCG over the measurement period, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period during the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_HSDPA_THR (M5006C62)
kpi_info.use: Average HSDPA MAC-hs/ehs throughput (including retransmissions) in LCG is the sum of the sampled data divided by the number of sampling periods over the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples in the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVAIL_HSDPA_THR (M5006C63)
kpi_info.use: The available HSDPA throughput in LCG. UPDATED: The counter is updated when LCG HW capacity, LCG configuration, HSDPA cell amount in LCG or HSDPA PS licenses amount is changed.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_HSUPA_THR (M5006C64)
kpi_info.use: Maximum HSUPA MAC-e/i throughput (including retransmissions) in LCG over the measurement period, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period for the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_HSUPA_THR (M5006C65)
kpi_info.use: Average HSUPA MAC-e/i throughput (including retransmissions) in LCG is the sum of the sampled data divided by the number of sampling periods over the measurement period. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples in the measurement period.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVAIL_HSUPA_THR (M5006C66)
kpi_info.use: The available HSUPA throughput in LCG. UPDATED: The counter is updated when LCG HW capacity, LCG configuration or HSUPA PS licenses amount is changed.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_HSDPA_PS_UTIL (M5006C67)
kpi_info.use: The maximum HSDPA Processing Sets Utilization ratio in LCG calculated as percentage of the used Processing Sets from the licensed Processing Sets, obtained by sampling with a predefined sampling period during measurement period. Retransmissions are included. Processing Set Utilization ratio is based on two conditions: 1) throughput utilization and 2) number of users. For the purpose of this counter, in each sample, both conditions need to be calculated. The average value of both conditions is used. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_HSDPA_PS_UTIL (M5006C68)
kpi_info.use: The average HSDPA Processing Sets Utilization ratio in LCG over the whole measurement period duration, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period, summing all the samples and dividing by the number of samples for the measurement period duration. Retransmissions are included. Processing Set Utilization ratio is based on two conditions: 1) throughput utilization and 2) number of users. For the purpose of this counter, in each sample, both conditions need to be calculated. The average value of both conditions is used. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_MAX_HSUPA_PS_UTIL (M5006C69)
kpi_info.use: The maximum HSUPA Processing Sets Utilization ratio in LCG calculated as percentage of the used Processing Sets from the licensed Processing Sets, obtained by sampling with a predefined sampling period during measurement period. Retransmissions are included. Processing Set Utilization ratio is based on two conditions: 1) throughput utilization, 2) number of users. For the purpose of this counter, in each sample period, all conditions are calculated. The average value of both conditions is used. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the maximum value of all samples.

kpi_info.title: LCG_AVG_HSUPA_PS_UTIL (M5006C70)
kpi_info.use: The average HSUPA Processing Sets Utilization ratio in LCG over the whole measurement period duration, obtained by sampling with predefined sampling period, summing all the samples and dividing by the number of samples for the measurement period duration. Retransmissions are included. Processing Set Utilization ratio is based on two conditions: 1) throughput utilization, 2) number of users. For the purpose of this counter, in each sample period, all conditions are calculated. The average value of both conditions is used. UPDATED: The counter is updated over the measurement period. The value of the counter is the average value of all samples.
